item.title: Xbox Cloud Streaming Of Own Games Launches Today
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/xbox-cloud-streaming-of-own-games-launches-today/

Xbox has officially launched, in beta form at least, its Cloud Streaming feature the lets players stream the games they own on a variety of devices.

Before the update, cloud gaming was only available for games included in the Xbox Game Pass library. This new feature expands that option to games that may not be a part of the service.

The feature is launching with 50 games available with more to come as the weeks and months continue. For the game’s listed, players are able to stream any version of the game they own. Microsoft used the example of The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt – Complete Edition and Cyberpunk 2077: Ultimate Edition.

Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscribers can access the feature in a number of ways such as through a browser at Xbox.com/Play or via the Xbox app on supported TV’s and the Meta Quest headset.

The full list of owned games you can now stream via the Xbox Cloud are:

  1. Animal Well
  2. Assassin’s Creed Mirage
  3. Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora
  4. Balatro
  5. Baldur’s Gate 3
  6. Banishers: Ghosts of New Eden
  7. Call of Duty: Modern Warfare II
  8. The Casting of Frank Stone
  9. Cyberpunk 2077
  10. Dragon Quest III HD-2D Remake
  11. DREDGE
  12. Dying Light 2 Stay Human
  13. Farming Simulator 25
  14. Fear the Spotlight
  15. Final Fantasy XIV Online 
  16. Final Fantasy
  17. Final Fantasy II 
  18. Final Fantasy III 
  19. Final Fantasy IV 
  20. Final Fantasy V 
  21. Final Fantasy VI 
  22. Hades
  23. Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions
  24. High On Life
  25. Hitman World of Assassination
  26. Hogwarts Legacy
  27. House Flipper 2
  28. Kena: Bridge of Spirits
  29. Lego Harry Potter Collection
  30. Life is Strange: Double Exposure
  31. Metro Exodus
  32. Mortal Kombat 1
  33. NBA 2K25
  34. PGA TOUR 2K23
  35. Phasmaphobia
  36. Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown
  37. Rust Console Edition
  38. 7 Days to Die
  39. Star Wars Outlaws
  40. Stray
  41. The Crew Motorfest
  42. The Outlast Trials
  43. The Plucky Squire
  44. The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
  45. Tom Clancy’s The Division 2
  46. TopSpin 2K25
  47. Undertale
  48. Visions of Mana
  49. Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2
  50. WWE 2K24

For more Insider Gaming, check out our in-depth review of STALKER 2: Heart of Chornobyl. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Dragon Ball Xenoverse 2’s Future Saga Chapter 2 DLC Arrives Tomorrow
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/dragon-ball-xenoverse-2-future-saga-chapter-2-dlc-arrives-tomorrow/

Dragon Ball Xenoverse 2’s Future Saga Chapter 2 DLC will be released on November 21, 2024, introducing a new storyline, fresh characters, and more.

In the Future Saga Chapter 2 DLC of Dragon Ball Xenoverse 2, the storyline begins with Fu using his powers on Jiren, turning him into the Ultra Supervillain. Consumed by rage, Universe 11’s prized fighter begins battling various Gods of Destruction from different universes, including Champa, Beerus, Belmod from Universe 11, and Goku. It will be exciting to see the outcome of this epic confrontation.

Dragon Ball Xenoverse 2’s Future Saga Chapter 2 DLC introduces several brand-new playable characters. The first is Jiren, who can be utilized in his Full Power and Ultra Supervillain forms. Next, we have Belmod, the God of Destruction from Universe 11. Finally, Goku (mini) from Dragon Ball Daima also joins the fight. The skills of these three playable characters can also be used with your custom characters, including Belmod’s Hakai, Goku’s Power Pole, and Jiren’s Omegaheat Magnetron.

In addition to the main storyline, the Future Saga Chapter 2 DLC includes four new parallel quests: “Warped Sense of Justice,” “Who’s the Next Leader,” “Havoc at the 3-Universe Feast,” and “The Tireless Pursuit of Strength.” Players can also look forward to new cosmetics, accessories, and loading screen illustrations.

In other news, here are the details on Dragon Ball Sparking Zero’s ‘The Dramatic Showdown’ Tournament. Also, 90% of Sparking Zero’s sales came from Europe and NA. What are your thoughts on Dragon Ball Xenoverse 2’s Future Saga Chapter 2 DLC? Let us know in the comments or our new community forum!

For more from Insider Gaming, read about Unknown 9: Awakening’s developer reducing their workforce by 18%. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter. 

Subscribe to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Unknown 9: Awakening Developer Reduces Workforce by 18%
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/unknown-9-awakening-developer-reduces-workforce-by-18/

Unknown 9: Awakening Developer Reflector Entertainment has announced that it is reducing the studio’s total workforce by 18%. 

The developer of Unknown 9: Awakening announced on its website (via GameIndustry.Biz) that it is shifting its focus as it enters a new phase of development. These changes aim to help the studio deliver on its objectives more efficiently and ensure that each team member can contribute meaningfully to ongoing projects. As a result, 18% of the workforce has been laid off.

Reflector Entertainment has announced that this decision is due to their “current reality,” which prevents them from guaranteeing “tangible work” for all employees. The studio will offer severance packages and access to medical support, emotional assistance, and career planning resources to ensure a smooth transition for those affected.

Moreover, the developers have stated that this decision will allow them “to take the necessary time” to refine and perfect their upcoming projects. The studio has released Unknown 9: Awakening and has two key production lines entering the early stages of development. They require their staff to be “laser-focused on contributing to the projects that wholly benefit from their skillsets.”

In other news, Thunderful recently announced a second wave of mass layoffs. Also, it cost Unity $205 million to make mass layoffs. What are your thoughts on Unknown 9: Awakening’s developer reducing their workforce by 18%? Let us know in the comments or our new community forum!

For more from Insider Gaming, read about the Final Fantasy 14 Mobile announcement. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Steam Controller 2 Set To Enter Mass Production, It’s Claimed

The next iteration of Valve’s Steam Controller appears set to enter mass production. According to a new claim from Valve insider Brad Lynch, Steam Controller 2, codenamed “Ibex” is in deep development. According to Lynch, Steam Controller 2 is “being tooled for a mass production” in factories and is in a “later [stage] of productization”. […]
